issue.title: e2e test improvements
issue.body:
## Goal

Fix a couple of test flakes and make the fixture output less noisy in some cases.

## Changeset

- Safely get JSON element values in the test fixture to avoid ugly stack traces (if Maze Runner were to change behaviour, for example).
- Trigger scenario actions on the main thread to make times more consistent and avoid flakes in 2 scenarios
- Stop the test fixture polling for commands as soon as a positive action is received, to avoid noisy output in the device log.

## Testing

Covered by a basic CI run, and I've rerun the flaky scenarios 100 times locally to verify they are fixed (except in the case of  
 CXXDelayedCrashScenario which needs more work, but is no worse than it was).

issue.title: Replaced "first significant stack frames" step with "any significant frames"
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow end to end tests to be more tolerant of platform changes when looking at native symbolicated stack traces. Some versions of Android cause `libunwind` to include signal handler frames at the top of the stack-trace causing a strict "first significant frames" check to fail.

## Design
Modified the "first significant stack frames" step to allow the list of expected frames to appear anywhere in the symbolicated stack-trace, as long as the frames remain sequential.

## Testing
Enabled all of the tests that were failing on Android 7 / 7.1 and verified they all run again.

issue.title: Avoid thread-starvation in BackgroundTaskService
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid possible thread starvation when submitting tasks to the `BackgroundTaskService`.

## Design
Changed the `BackgroundTaskService` to internally be able to identify its threads. When a new task is submitted it will first check to see if the task would be sent to the current thread, and if so the task is run immediately and the result is returned.

## Testing
A new unit test was added that causes thread starvation by adding a task to each queue, which then adds a task to the same queue and then blocks on both tasks to await their completion. This triggers a deadlock as the first task waits for itself to complete.

issue.title: Introduce option to attempt delivery on crash
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow a delivery attempt to be made during a crash (when configured).

## Design
When configured by `Configuration.setAttemptDeliveryOnCrash(true)` an unhandled JVM exception will be encoded to storage, and then the notifier will immediately attempt to deliver it on our existing worker. The delivery will block the crashing thread for a maximum of 3 seconds before cancelling the delivery attempt and returning.

The 3 second allowance:
- ensures that the app does not complete its crash while the notifier is attempting delivery
- should avoid triggering an ANR in most cases (the encoding and storage of the error is counted towards this deadline)

## Testing
A new end to end test scenario was added to test this functionality by throwing an unhandled exception, and expecting delivery *without* an app restart.

issue.body:

Leverage the existing `write` and `flushEventFile` methods. The `flushEventFile` is called from within a scheduled task with `writeAndDeliver` returning the `Future` handle for that delivery (allowing external synchronisation).

## Testing
Manually tested in context. The full end-to-end test will be in the next PR.

issue.title: Encode line numbers as hex strings instead of numbers
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid potential overflow issues when storing addresses in the `lineNumber` property by encoding them as hex strings. When native crashes occur we store the relative PC in the `lineNumber` property, which may be larger than a JSON number can hold.

## Design
Encode all `lineNumber` values as hex strings instead of raw JSON numbers. These are automatically decoded again on the server-side and still present as decimal numbers in the dashboard.

## Testing
Altered all of the existing test fixtures that check line-numbers to use the hex-encoded string syntax

issue.title: Improve reliability of EventStoreConfinementTest
issue.body:
## Goal
Lower the probability that `EventStoreConfinementTest` fails due to over-strict verification.

## Design
`EventStoreConfinementTest` silently relies on the order of files being listed (due to the way `EventStore.flushAsync` works). As a result the assertions sometimes fail when files are not returned in the expected order.

The test does not need to depend on the file order however, and instead is attempting to ensure no unexpected files are being delivered.

## Changeset
Change the `flushAsyncIsThreadConfined` assertion to check each file against a list of "expected" files, and report if an unexpected file is being delivered.

The report will now include the index of the file being checked, alongside the list of files it still expects to see (to aid future debugging).

## Testing
Rerun the test many times locally without it breaking.

issue.title: Improve NDK stack-unwinder data
issue.body:
## Goal
Improve the NDK stack-unwinder availability to symbol data.

## Design
Introduced the ability to refresh the cached symbol / maps data in the native stack-unwinder:

- a new `bugsnag_refresh_symbol_table` function for native code
- a new `BugsnagNDK.refreshSymbolTable()` as part of the `bugsnag-plugin-android-ndk` module for Java / Kotlin code using `System.loadLibrary` after startup
- when the app startup is marked as complete, the native layer will refresh to handle any libraries that were loaded between `Bugsnag.start` and startup completion (for example in the main activity, or similar)

## Testing
Moved the `CXXExternalStackElementScenario` into the `cxx-scenarios-bugsnag` project, so that it can use the new API and ensure it behaves as expected.

issue.title: Report the Build ID in codeIdentifier
issue.body:
## Goal
Report the "BuildID" of `.so` files for each frame where it can be identified.

## Design
After unwinding the stack, attempt to identify the "Build ID" from `MapInfo` for each frame. The Build ID or MapInfo will be empty if the frame is not backed by a `.so` file (such as Dex frames) or if the module has no `.note.gnu.build-id`. In these cases the `codeIdentifier` will be left as `null`.

## Testing
New unit tests to cover the new structure and migration, additions to the end-to-end tests.

issue.title: Replaced "first significant stack frames" step with "any significant frames"
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow end to end tests to be more tolerant of platform changes when looking at native symbolicated stack traces. Some versions of Android cause `libunwind` to include signal handler frames at the top of the stack-trace causing a strict "first significant frames" check to fail.

## Design
Modified the "first significant stack frames" step to allow the list of expected frames to appear anywhere in the symbolicated stack-trace, as long as the frames remain sequential.

## Testing
Enabled all of the tests that were failing on Android 7 / 7.1 and verified they all run again.

issue.title: Avoid thread-starvation in BackgroundTaskService
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid possible thread starvation when submitting tasks to the `BackgroundTaskService`.

## Design
Changed the `BackgroundTaskService` to internally be able to identify its threads. When a new task is submitted it will first check to see if the task would be sent to the current thread, and if so the task is run immediately and the result is returned.

## Testing
A new unit test was added that causes thread starvation by adding a task to each queue, which then adds a task to the same queue and then blocks on both tasks to await their completion. This triggers a deadlock as the first task waits for itself to complete.

issue.title: Introduce option to attempt delivery on crash
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow a delivery attempt to be made during a crash (when configured).

## Design
When configured by `Configuration.setAttemptDeliveryOnCrash(true)` an unhandled JVM exception will be encoded to storage, and then the notifier will immediately attempt to deliver it on our existing worker. The delivery will block the crashing thread for a maximum of 3 seconds before cancelling the delivery attempt and returning.

The 3 second allowance:
- ensures that the app does not complete its crash while the notifier is attempting delivery
- should avoid triggering an ANR in most cases (the encoding and storage of the error is counted towards this deadline)

## Testing
A new end to end test scenario was added to test this functionality by throwing an unhandled exception, and expecting delivery *without* an app restart.

issue.title: Encode line numbers as hex strings instead of numbers
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid potential overflow issues when storing addresses in the `lineNumber` property by encoding them as hex strings. When native crashes occur we store the relative PC in the `lineNumber` property, which may be larger than a JSON number can hold.

## Design
Encode all `lineNumber` values as hex strings instead of raw JSON numbers. These are automatically decoded again on the server-side and still present as decimal numbers in the dashboard.

## Testing
Altered all of the existing test fixtures that check line-numbers to use the hex-encoded string syntax

issue.title: Improve reliability of EventStoreConfinementTest
issue.body:
## Goal
Lower the probability that `EventStoreConfinementTest` fails due to over-strict verification.

## Design
`EventStoreConfinementTest` silently relies on the order of files being listed (due to the way `EventStore.flushAsync` works). As a result the assertions sometimes fail when files are not returned in the expected order.

The test does not need to depend on the file order however, and instead is attempting to ensure no unexpected files are being delivered.

## Changeset
Change the `flushAsyncIsThreadConfined` assertion to check each file against a list of "expected" files, and report if an unexpected file is being delivered.

The report will now include the index of the file being checked, alongside the list of files it still expects to see (to aid future debugging).

## Testing
Rerun the test many times locally without it breaking.

issue.title: Improve NDK stack-unwinder data
issue.body:
## Goal
Improve the NDK stack-unwinder availability to symbol data.

## Design
Introduced the ability to refresh the cached symbol / maps data in the native stack-unwinder:

- a new `bugsnag_refresh_symbol_table` function for native code
- a new `BugsnagNDK.refreshSymbolTable()` as part of the `bugsnag-plugin-android-ndk` module for Java / Kotlin code using `System.loadLibrary` after startup
- when the app startup is marked as complete, the native layer will refresh to handle any libraries that were loaded between `Bugsnag.start` and startup completion (for example in the main activity, or similar)

## Testing
Moved the `CXXExternalStackElementScenario` into the `cxx-scenarios-bugsnag` project, so that it can use the new API and ensure it behaves as expected.

issue.title: Report the Build ID in codeIdentifier
issue.body:
## Goal
Report the "BuildID" of `.so` files for each frame where it can be identified.

## Design
After unwinding the stack, attempt to identify the "Build ID" from `MapInfo` for each frame. The Build ID or MapInfo will be empty if the frame is not backed by a `.so` file (such as Dex frames) or if the module has no `.note.gnu.build-id`. In these cases the `codeIdentifier` will be left as `null`.

## Testing
New unit tests to cover the new structure and migration, additions to the end-to-end tests.

issue.title: Replaced "first significant stack frames" step with "any significant frames"
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow end to end tests to be more tolerant of platform changes when looking at native symbolicated stack traces. Some versions of Android cause `libunwind` to include signal handler frames at the top of the stack-trace causing a strict "first significant frames" check to fail.

## Design
Modified the "first significant stack frames" step to allow the list of expected frames to appear anywhere in the symbolicated stack-trace, as long as the frames remain sequential.

## Testing
Enabled all of the tests that were failing on Android 7 / 7.1 and verified they all run again.

issue.title: Avoid thread-starvation in BackgroundTaskService
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid possible thread starvation when submitting tasks to the `BackgroundTaskService`.

## Design
Changed the `BackgroundTaskService` to internally be able to identify its threads. When a new task is submitted it will first check to see if the task would be sent to the current thread, and if so the task is run immediately and the result is returned.

## Testing
A new unit test was added that causes thread starvation by adding a task to each queue, which then adds a task to the same queue and then blocks on both tasks to await their completion. This triggers a deadlock as the first task waits for itself to complete.

issue.title: Introduce option to attempt delivery on crash
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow a delivery attempt to be made during a crash (when configured).

## Design
When configured by `Configuration.setAttemptDeliveryOnCrash(true)` an unhandled JVM exception will be encoded to storage, and then the notifier will immediately attempt to deliver it on our existing worker. The delivery will block the crashing thread for a maximum of 3 seconds before cancelling the delivery attempt and returning.

The 3 second allowance:
- ensures that the app does not complete its crash while the notifier is attempting delivery
- should avoid triggering an ANR in most cases (the encoding and storage of the error is counted towards this deadline)

## Testing
A new end to end test scenario was added to test this functionality by throwing an unhandled exception, and expecting delivery *without* an app restart.

issue.title: Encode line numbers as hex strings instead of numbers
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid potential overflow issues when storing addresses in the `lineNumber` property by encoding them as hex strings. When native crashes occur we store the relative PC in the `lineNumber` property, which may be larger than a JSON number can hold.

## Design
Encode all `lineNumber` values as hex strings instead of raw JSON numbers. These are automatically decoded again on the server-side and still present as decimal numbers in the dashboard.

## Testing
Altered all of the existing test fixtures that check line-numbers to use the hex-encoded string syntax

## Goal
Lower the probability that `EventStoreConfinementTest` fails due to over-strict verification.

## Design
`EventStoreConfinementTest` silently relies on the order of files being listed (due to the way `EventStore.flushAsync` works). As a result the assertions sometimes fail when files are not returned in the expected order.

The test does not need to depend on the file order however, and instead is attempting to ensure no unexpected files are being delivered.

## Changeset
Change the `flushAsyncIsThreadConfined` assertion to check each file against a list of "expected" files, and report if an unexpected file is being delivered.

The report will now include the index of the file being checked, alongside the list of files it still expects to see (to aid future debugging).

## Testing
Rerun the test many times locally without it breaking.

issue.title: Improve NDK stack-unwinder data
issue.body:
## Goal
Improve the NDK stack-unwinder availability to symbol data.

## Design
Introduced the ability to refresh the cached symbol / maps data in the native stack-unwinder:

- a new `bugsnag_refresh_symbol_table` function for native code
- a new `BugsnagNDK.refreshSymbolTable()` as part of the `bugsnag-plugin-android-ndk` module for Java / Kotlin code using `System.loadLibrary` after startup
- when the app startup is marked as complete, the native layer will refresh to handle any libraries that were loaded between `Bugsnag.start` and startup completion (for example in the main activity, or similar)

## Testing
Moved the `CXXExternalStackElementScenario` into the `cxx-scenarios-bugsnag` project, so that it can use the new API and ensure it behaves as expected.

issue.title: Reduce flakes in the ANR Smoke Test on Android 4
issue.body:
## Goal
Attempt to reduce flakes in the ANR Smoke Test on Android 4 devices.

## Design
The test scenario now taps the screen, then waits 5 seconds, and finally uses the back button to try force an ANR. While this takes a little longer than previously, it more closely mimics expected user behaviour.

## Testing
Reran the test scenario several times without the ANR scenario flaking.

issue.title: Report the Build ID in codeIdentifier
issue.body:
## Goal
Report the "BuildID" of `.so` files for each frame where it can be identified.

## Design
After unwinding the stack, attempt to identify the "Build ID" from `MapInfo` for each frame. The Build ID or MapInfo will be empty if the frame is not backed by a `.so` file (such as Dex frames) or if the module has no `.note.gnu.build-id`. In these cases the `codeIdentifier` will be left as `null`.

## Testing
New unit tests to cover the new structure and migration, additions to the end-to-end tests.

issue.title: Report "Build ID" as codeIdentifier in NDK stacktraces
issue.body:
## Goal
When reporting native stack traces, we need to include the "Build ID" as `codeIdentifier` for each stack frame (when it's available) so that we can later retrieve the correct symbol data.

## Changeset

- Add the "Build ID" to the stack-frames in the NDK event model during a crash
- Use `NativeStackframe` instead of `StackTraceElement` to relay `bugsnag_notify` events to the JVM layer

## Testing
New unit tests and additional checks on top of existing end-to-end testing
